v.v: Yahweh, I will sing forever about the ways you faithfully love me;
I will tell people that you will faithfully love us forever,
Yahweh said, “I have made an agreement with David, whom I chose to serve me.
‘I will enable various ones of your descendants to always be kings;
Yahweh, I desire that all those beings who are in heaven will praise you for the wonderful things that you do,
There is no one in heaven who can be compared with you, Yahweh.
When your holy angels gather together,
O Yahweh God, commander of the angel armies, there is no one who is as powerful as you are;
You rule over the powerful seas;
You are the one who crushed and killed the great sea monster named Rahab.
The heavens are yours, and the earth is yours;
You created everything from the north to the south.
You are very powerful;
You rule over people fairly and justly;
Yahweh, how fortunate are those who worship you with joyful shouts in their festivals,
Every day, throughout the day, they rejoice in what you have done,
You give us your glorious strength;
Yahweh, you gave us the one who protects us;
Long ago you spoke in a vision to one of your servants, saying,
That man is David, the one who will serve me faithfully,
My strength will always be with him;
His enemies will never find ways to outwit him,
I will crush his enemies in front of him
I will always be loyal to him and faithfully love him
I will cause his kingdom to include all the land from the Mediterranean Sea to the Euphrates River.
He will say to me, ‘You are my Father,
I will give him the rights as my firstborn son;
I will always be loyal to him,
I will establish a line of his descendants that will never end,
But if some of his descendants disobey my laws
if they disregard my requirements
I will punish them severely
But I will not stop faithfully loving David,
I will not break the agreement that I made with him;
Once I made a solemn promise to David, and that will never change;
I promised that the line of kings descended from him will go on forever;
That line will be as permanent as the moon
But Yahweh, now you have rejected him!
It seems that you have broken the agreement that you made with your servant, David;
You have torn down the walls that protect his city
All those who pass by plunder his possessions;
You have enabled his enemies to defeat him;
You have caused his sword to become useless,
You have caused his splendor to end
You have caused him to become old when he is still young
O Yahweh, how long will this continue?
Do not forget that life is very short;
No one can keep on living and never die;
Yahweh, you promised long ago
Yahweh, do not forget that people insult us!
Yahweh, your enemies insult your chosen king!
I hope that Yahweh will be praised forever!

v: people not yet born will hear that you faithfully do all that you have promised.
and that your being faithful to do what you have promised is as permanent as the sky.
I have made this solemn agreement with him:
the line of kings descended from you will never end.’”
and that all your holy angels will sing about how you faithfully do what you promise.
There are no angels in heaven who are equal to you.
they declare that you must be revered;
they say that you are more awesome than all the angels that surround your throne!
your faithfully doing all that you promise is like a cloak that always surrounds you.
when their waves rise up, you calm them.
You defeated and scattered your enemies with your great power.
everything on the earth is yours because you created it all.
Mount Tabor and Mount Hermon joyfully praise you .
you are extremely strong.
you are always faithfully loving us and doing what you promised.
who live knowing that you are always watching over them.
and they praise you for being very good to them.
because you act in our favor, we defeat our enemies.
you, the holy God whom we Israelites worship, he gave us our king.
“I have crowned a famous soldier;
I chose him from among all the people to be a king.
and I anointed him with sacred olive oil to make him king.
with my power, I will make him strong.
and wicked people will never defeat him.
and get rid of those who hate him.
and enable him to defeat his enemies.
my God, the one who protects and saves me.’
he will be the greatest king on the earth.
and my agreement to bless him will last forever.
various ones of his descendants will always be kings.
and do not behave as my commands say that they should,
and do not do the right things that I have told them to do,
and cause them to suffer for doing wrong.
and I will always do what I promised him.
I will not change even one word that I spoke to him.
because I am God, I will never lie to David.
it will last as long as the sun shines.
that is always watching everything here on earth.”
You are very angry with the king whom you appointed.
it seems as though you have thrown his crown into the dust.
and allowed all his forts to become ruins.
his neighbors laugh at him.
you have made them all happy.
and you have not helped him in his battles.
and knocked his throne to the ground.
and caused him to be very shamed.
Will you hide yourself from us forever?
How long will your anger against us burn like a fire?
Do not forget that you have created all of us to die uselessly.
no one can bring himself back from the place of the dead.
that you would faithfully love me;
why are you not doing that?
You solemnly promised this to David!
Heathen people curse me!
They insult him wherever he goes.
Amen! May it be so!
